note.p: Career: MP for Heytesbury (1725-1727); MP for Westminster (1727-1734); MP for Derbyshire (1734-1741); Gentleman of the Bedchamber to Frederick, Prince of Wales (1728-1730); devised a self-registering thermometer which was used to measure the temperature of sea water at depth
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Sedgwick; Taylor Hanoverian
References: J S Rowlinson, 'Aristocratic Physics', review of Christa Jungnickel and Russell McCormmach, Cavendish in NR 1998 vol 52 pp 194-196
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166

Notes: Pogg gives date of birth as 1703. JB states VP Oct 1751, Jan 1752, Dec 1755 and Jun 1757. May have been VP for other years, not noted on PL. Sedgwick gives date of birth as after 1700. Proposed by William Jones
